usefulItems: serving bowl, plastic wrap, small bowl , large frying pan, serving platter, refrigerator, stove top
title: Mediterranean carrot fritters

ingredients.content: ½ red onion, cut into quarters
3 slices wholegrain bread, torn into small pieces
6 sprigs fresh dill, leaves only, plus extra for serving
500 g carrots, cut into pieces (4 cm)
½ tsp ground black pepper, to taste
4 spring onions/shallots, cut into thin slices

preparations.content: Place onion and coriander into mixing bowl and chop <b>3 sec/speed 7<b>.
Add yoghurt and mix <b>5 sec/speed 3<b>. Transfer into a serving bowl and cover with plastic wrap. Place into refrigerator until ready to serve. Clean and dry mixing bowl.
Place bread, mint and dill into mixing bowl and chop <b>3 sec/speed 7<b>. Transfer into a small bowl and set aside.
Place water into mixing bowl. Place Varoma dish into position and weigh 250 g of the carrots into it. Secure Varoma lid and steam <b>12 min/Varoma/speed 1<b>. Remove Varoma and empty mixing bowl.
Place apricots, salt, pepper, steamed carrots and remaining 250 g carrots into mixing bowl and mix <b>3 sec/speed 7<b>.
Add spring onions/shallots, sultanas, pine nuts, chilli flakes, egg and reserved breadcrumb mixture and mix <b>20 sec/speed 3<b>, or until a soft, slightly damp mixture forms.
Using hands, roll 1 tablespoon of mixture into a small rissole shape and place onto a plate. Continue with remaining mixture (makes approx. 25 patties). Place into refrigerator for 30 minutes.

Place a large frying pan over medium-high heat and add just enough oil to coat base of pan. Working in batches, place patties into pan and cook for approx. 4-5 minutes each side, or until golden brown and cooked through.
Place fritters onto a serving platter with red onion and yoghurt dip. Sprinkle dip with extra dill leaves before serving.

hintsAndTricks: You can make these fritters in advance - they are great for packed lunches, picnics and parties.
